definitions: Make a visible impression or a spot on (something).
Write or draw a symbol or sign on (something).
Indicate the position of (something) by making a mark.
Assign a grade or score to (a student's work or performance).
Be a characteristic or distinguishing feature of.
Celebrate or commemorate (a special event or occasion).
Designate (a person or thing) for a particular purpose or fate.
Follow or guard (an opposing player) in a game.
examples: The scratch will mark the table permanently.
He marked the correct answer with a cross.
Mark your calendars for the meeting.
The teacher will mark the essays tonight.
His kindness marks him as a true gentleman.
Mark my words, he will succeed.
They marked their anniversary with a dinner.
He was marked for greatness from an early age.
The defender needs to mark his man more closely.
